title: Wall of Stone
lyrics:
The Time Had Come… My Heart Was Numb.
One Deep Sigh… The Long Good-Bye.
We Stood Tall… Children and All.
Heads bowed In Awe… For God's Last Call.
Soldiers in Line… It's Almost Time.
Pride in Chest… At Parade Rest.
Now We Stand… And Hear the Command.
Two in Stride… Not Their First Time.
A Flag they Hold… Corner to Corner
13 Folds… In Your Honor.
The Soldier Finds His Next in Line.
Tears Now Climb… Can't Stop Time.
5 Rifles High. Into the Sky.
3 Shots Fired. 15 Retired.
Shells to the Ground. Makes a Sound.
I Now hold… Deep Deep Down.
15 Shells and a Wall Of Stone. Locked inside but Not Alone.
Shells to the Ground. Now A Sound. That I Hold Dear… Deep Deep Down.
Bridge
Last In the Row… A Bugle Blows.
Taps an Echo… Tears Now Flow.
All is Silent… We Stand Alone.
Not your Home… This Tall Wall of Stone.
It's Later Now… Hard to Believe.
Few Know How… These Shells Remind Me.
I am your Son… and Proud To Be.
I am your Son… Yeah This is Me.
bio: sample bio that can be long or short and can contain any information about the artist or the song

title: Chains Of St. James
lyrics:
In 1831… Under A Hot Sun.
Sugar And Slaves… Were Bound As One.
It Was Always Known… Not To Be Undone.
Owned by A Thrown… And Ruled By A Gun.
But In Old St James… On a Cold Christmas Day.
This would Change… In Every Way.

**Chorus** 
*To the Souls… Who Fought & Prayed.*
*You Broke These Old Chains… On that Day.*

 Led By a Cross… The Slaves without A Cost.
Armed with Rage… They Rose Up Day.
They Set Fires Ablaze… For Each To Say.
Be On your Way… Be Free This Day.
For 11 Days… They All Defied.
Then they Paid… With 500 Lives.

**Chorus** 
*To the Souls… Who Fought & Prayed.*
*You Broke These Old Chains… On that Day.*

**Bridge**
And Their Leader… A Baptist Preacher.
On That Day… Was Hung… in Montego Bay.

**Chorus** 
 *To the Souls… Who Fought & Prayed.*
*You Broke These Old Chains… On that Day.*

We Know Today… This Was Not In Silent Pain.
You Did Not Die… Did Not Die in Vain.
By 1834… A New Law Was Made.
There will be no more… Chains in St James.
No more… No More Chains in St James.
